title: What is the difference between atomic structure and crystal structure? - Quora

response.answer_text: Home Answer 7 Notifications Atomic structure referes to the nature of an atom. According to the model of Bohr (1913) electrons orbit around a nucleus of protons and neutrons.  This model is still useful but has its shortcomings. In the quantum mechanical model the nucleus is surrounded by a clould of electrons.  You may check-out Wikipedia for details Atomic orbital - Wikipedia Using high end aberration-corrected microscopes, you can “see” the atom as a sphere, but you cannot see the nucleus.  The crystal structure refers to the 3D arrangement of atoms, molecules or ions in a crystal. For example this is the crystal strucure of salt, NaCl  And this is the crystal structure of gold  Or one of several crystal structures of ice

Atomic structure is what the atom is composed of: electrons, protons, neutrons. This includes how many of each particle there are, how many orbitals, etc. Crystal structure is the three dimensional structure a solid of any compound will form according to the electronic structures of the constituent atoms of the compound.
